intro: Acer nayongense var. hunanense, commonly known as the Hunan maple, is a variant of the Nanyong maple native to southern China. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in autumn. The plant belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for landscaping in temperate regions.
